com.direwolfdigital.cake.rules.abilities: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon and heal all damage from it.
This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Benched Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Move any number of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.
Your opponent can't play any cards from their hand during their next turn. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.
This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads. If either of them is heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
For each Energy attached to your opponent's Pokémon, attach a {R} Energy card from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.
This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a {N} Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
If this Pokémon evolved from Kakuna during this turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.
This attack does 40 damage for each of your remaining Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.
If this Pokémon has any {D} Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to the new Active Pokémon.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.
Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
Your opponent can't play any Pokémon that has an Ability from their hand during their next turn.

Choose 2 cards from your discard pile. Then, ask your opponent if you may put them into your hand. If yes, put those cards into your hand. If no, this attack does 80 damage to your opponent’s Active Pokémon.
Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.
Put 3 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched {L} Pokémon.
Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.
This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Before doing damage, you may discard any number of Pokémon Tool cards from your Pokémon. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.
During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.
If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 2 more Prize cards. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.
Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
Put 2 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
You may discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.
Search your deck for up to 3 Kakuna and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Take a Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.
During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
If you have fewer Pokémon in play than your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.
Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.
You may put up to 9 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.
Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.
Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Shuffle 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it and all cards attached to it into their deck.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from their hand during their next turn.
This attack does 20 damage for each card in your opponent's hand.
The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to their Prize cards. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.
If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
You may discard a Special Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.
Put 3 Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.
This Pokémon is now Asleep. Heal 90 damage from it.
During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.
Discard any Stadium card in play.
This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
If Regice is on your Bench, heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.
Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.
This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by the damage from this attack, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
If any of your opponent’s Pokémon have any {D} Energy attached to them, this attack does 60 more damage.
This Pokémon can't use Bright Horns during your next turn.
Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

This card provides {C} Energy. \n\nIf you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, and if this card is attached to a Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 2 Energy at a time.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may leave both Active Pokémon Confused and Poisoned.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.
This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from the attacks of your opponent's non-{R} Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.
If you have Regirock in play, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Stage 2 Pokémon.
As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, heal 90 damage from that Pokémon.
Your Registeel's attacks do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
This Pokémon's attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's {G} Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
This Pokémon can't attack unless Regirock, Regice, and Registeel are on your Bench.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Shelmet from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
If there is any Stadium card in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 3 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, discard your other Benched Pokémon.
You can play this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.\n\nSwitch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

This card provides {C} Energy. \n\nIf you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, and if this card is attached to a Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 2 Energy at a time.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to discards Energy for its Retreat Cost, put that Energy into your hand instead of the discard pile.
The attacks of {D} Pokémon and {N} Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a {F} Pokémon.

Look at your face-down Prize cards and put 1 of them into your hand. Then, shuffle this Gladion into your remaining Prize cards and put them back face down. If you didn’t play this Gladion from your hand, it does nothing.
Put 2 in any combination of Supporter and Stadium cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon-GX, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Your opponent reveals their hand. You may have your opponent count the cards in their hand, shuffle those cards into their deck, then draw that many cards.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a {P} Pokémon.
Special Conditions are not removed when Pokémon (both yours and your opponent’s) evolve or devolve.
This card provides {C} Energy. \n\nWhen you attach this card from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch that Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, move up to 3 basic Energy cards from that Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
customchoice.sm4_21.forcefultackle: Would you like to put damage counters on this Pokémon to do more damage?
customchoice.sm4_23.specialartillery: Would you like to discard a Special Energy from this Pokémon to do 80 more damage?
customchoice.sm4_45.pumpkinbomb: You may choose Pokémon Tool cards to discard. This attack will do 40 more damage for each one.
customchoice.sm4_49.emptylight: Would you like to leave both Active Pokémon Confused and Poisoned?
customchoice.sm4_62.darkdestruction: Would you like to discard an Energy from this Pokémon in order to discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon?
customchoice.sm4_70.sliceoff: Would you like to discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon?
customchoice.sm4_86.amazingplea: Allow your opponent to put these cards into their hand? If no, this attack does 80 damage to your Active Pokémon.
customchoice.sm4_86.amazingpleaa: These are the cards your opponent has chosen for Amazing Plea.
customchoice.sm4_97.peekingredcard: Would you like your opponent to shuffle the cards in their hand into their deck and draw that many cards?
playmat.prompt.choosetoolsforhand: Choose Pokémon Tool cards to put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.chooseupto2forhand: Choose up to 2 cards to put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.maychooseenergydiscard: You may choose an Energy card to discard.
playmat.prompt.sm4_12.danceofflames: Choose {R} Energy cards to attach to your Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.sm4_2.multiply: Choose up to 3 Kakuna to put onto your Bench.
playmat.prompt.sm4_21.forcefultackle: Choose how many damage counters you want to put on this Pokémon. This attack will do 10 more damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.
playmat.prompt.sm4_27.tlc: Choose an opponent's Benched Pokémon to shuffle it and all cards attached to it into their deck.
playmat.prompt.sm4_35.energycatch: Choose basic Energy cards to put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.sm4_62.weedout: Choose 3 of your Benched Pokémon to remain on your Bench. Your other Benched Pokémon will be discarded.
playmat.prompt.sm4_80.dracomelody: Choose a {N} Pokémon to put onto your Bench.
playmat.prompt.sm4_96.lusamine: Choose Supporter and/or Stadium cards to put into your hand.
specialvisualizations.damagetakenreduced: This Pokémon takes less damage from the attacks of opposing non-{R} Pokémon.
specialvisualizations.player.sm4_34.heav: This player can't play any cards from their hand.
specialvisualizations.player.sm4_38.gnaw: Whenever this player attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, that Pokémon will get 2 damage counters.
specialvisualizations.player.sm4_43.bell: This player can't play any Pokémon that has an Ability from their hand.
specialvisualizations.player.sm4_90.gyro: This player's Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.
specialvisualizations.player.sm4_93.devo: The attacks of {D} Pokémon and {N} Pokémon do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon.
specialvisualizations.sm4_28.icebergshie: This Pokémon is immune to all effects of attacks, including damage, done by opposing Stage 2 Pokémon.
specialvisualizations.sm4_77.submerge: This Pokémon takes no damage from attacks.
tpci.product.sm4.blister.sell-text: The mysterious Ultra Beasts have arrived, invading the Alola region as crimson-tinged Pokémon-GX: Nihilego-GX, Buzzwole-GX, Kartana-GX, and the ravenous Guzzlord-GX! Can Silvally-GX and the other allies of Alola defend the islands—or will the Ultra Beasts take control? Find out when you battle for the prize with the Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon—Crimson Invasion expansion!
tpci.product.sm4.pcd-1.deck.name: Destruction Fang
tpci.product.sm4.pcd-1.deck.sell-text: Armed with fangs, claws, and poison, Hydreigon and friends are ready to battle! This dangerous deck calls on Darkness- and Psychic-type Pokémon with howling fury and keen instincts. Make a furious attack work for you with the Destruction Fang theme deck!
tpci.product.sm4.pcd-2.deck.name: Clanging Thunder
tpci.product.sm4.pcd-2.deck.sell-text: Kommo-o makes a mighty noise in battle! With a thunderous crew of Fighting and Lightning types, you can tear it up with huge hits and powerful Pokémon. The Clanging Thunder theme deck is going extra-big at full volume!
tpci.product.sm4.pcd.sell-text: The mysterious Ultra Beasts have arrived, invading the Alola region as crimson-tinged Pokémon-GX: Nihilego-GX, Buzzwole-GX, Kartana-GX, and the ravenous Guzzlord-GX! Can Silvally-GX and the other allies of Alola defend the islands—or will the Ultra Beasts take control? Find out when you battle for the prize with the Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon—Crimson Invasion expansion!
